body_html: @ezyang I think we should do it after this PR is merged. For context, we are hoping that using MinGW gcc would allow us to enable OpenMP 4.0 features on Windows, thus bridging the CPU perf gap between Windows and Linux. If this path is successful we might be able to consider shipping Windows CPU binaries compiled with MinGW instead of MSVC.

body: @ezyang I think we should do it after this PR is merged. For context, we are hoping that using MinGW gcc would allow us to enable OpenMP 4.0 features on Windows, thus bridging the CPU perf gap between Windows and Linux. If this path is successful we might be able to consider shipping Windows CPU binaries compiled with MinGW instead of MSVC.
